activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daquan X. Scott

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:00 AM Defendant Daquan X. Scott appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared in person for Daquan X. Scott.  Attorney David S Olson appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. Officer Todd Schumann of the Janesville Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. Parties stipulate to convictions in cases 18CM768 and 18CF962. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
Preliminary hearing on August 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.

9:20 AM  Defendant Daquan X. Scott in court, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Daquan X. Scott.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Witness unavailable. Matter continued for Witness to be present.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
